article.description: Tim Hardaway hit a go-ahead 3-pointer to ignite a game-ending 16-2 run that led the Dallas Mavericks to a 112-100 victory over the New Jersey Nets on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Mavericks put away Nets with closing 16-2 run

images.name: Kidd_jason 020602 inline
images.caption: Steve Nash helped the Mavs flatten Jason Kidd and the Nets' eight-game home winning streak.

article.linkText: Mavs close out Nets with 16-2 run for seventh straight road win
article.story:
EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- The Dallas Mavericks showed the New Jersey Nets why they are the NBA's best road team. Playing with little rest after a double-overtime win over Indiana and without suspended forward Juwan Howard, the Mavericks used a game-ending 16-2 run to beat the Nets 112-100 on Wednesday night. "I'm very proud of this team, coming into two hostile places," said Tim Hardaway, who hit a go-ahead 3-pointer to ignite the late run. "After double overtime in Indiana, we had enough courage to come out here and play with only nine people. We played a heck of a ballgame against the top team in the East." Hardaway had seven of his 11 points in the run that led Dallas to a team record-tying seventh straight road win and ended the Nets' eight-game home winning streak. Dallas, which set a team record by hitting all 27 of its free throws, is now a league-best 17-7 on the road. It has won 23 of its last 28 games, the best run in franchise history. "We had to hang in there," said point guard Steve Nash, who added 18 points and 12 assists. "There were times we could have folded our tents. We were tough-minded. We hung in there when things could have easily gone the other way." Dallas, which didn't arrive at its hotel in New Jersey until 4 a.m., had contributions from almost everyone in its final game before the All-Star break. Dirk Nowitzki had 22 points, Wang Zhizhi added career-high 15 points, Adrian Griffin added 14 and Michael Finley had 10 as six of the Mavericks' nine players finished in double figures. "We've had the best start (35-14) I think I've ever had at the halfway mark," Mavericks coach Don Nelson said. "I can't remember a better one." Nelson won't have the weekend off. He is coaching the West in the All-Star game in Philadelphia on Sunday. Byron Scott of the Nets (32-15) will coach the East. Kenyon Martin had 26 points, Keith Van Horn added 21 and Jason Kidd had 14 points and 12 assists for the Nets, who were shut out in the final 4:25 in seeing their three-game overall winning streak end. "They're a team that likes to get the ball out and score," Kidd said. "They want to want to get up and down. Their game is to play and get as many points and that means to try to get it into the 100s. They did that well tonight. They didn't look like the team that played last night, we looked like the team that played last night." New Jersey, which trailed by 12 at the half, outscored Dallas 34-20 in the third quarter to take an 86-84 lead. Kidd gave the Nets leads of 95-94 and 98-96 with a drive across the lane and a 3-pointer, respectively. Right after the 3-pointer, Hardaway made a high-arcing 3-pointer from the left corner for a 99-98 lead with 5:49 to play. After a couple of misses by each team, Wang hit a set shot to make it 101-98 with 4:39 to go. Martin scored on an ally-oop dunk from Kidd with 4:25 to go but Dallas scored the final 11 points with Hardaway adding the finishing touches with a jumper and two free throws. Nash hit a big 3-pointer and Nowitzki added a jumper. The game between the leaders of the Eastern Conference and the third-best team in the West was an event. Mavericks owner Mark Cuban sat behind the Dallas bench and across from great Magic Johnson, the close friend of Nets' coach Byron Scott. They were treated to an uptempo game that featured great passes by two of the best point guards in the game, spectacular dunks and an exciting contest. The Mavericks shot nearly 56 percent in the first half and got 15 points from Nash, 10 apiece from Nowitzki and Michael Finley and a surprising nine from Wang in a two-minute first quarter blitz that helped build a 64-52 halftime lead. However, the Nets dominated the third quarter just like they did on Monday night in handing Sacramento -- the best in the West -- its worst loss of the season. Martin had eight points and Kittles, Van Horn and rookie Jason Collins each added seven.

Game notes
Mavericks are 28-3 when they score 100 points. ... Dallas is 16-6 against teams with records of .500 or better. ...Dallas is 24-1 when leading at the start of the second quarter. ... Only nine of the Mavericks' games have been decided by five points or less. Kidd tied his career high for steals with six. ...Kerry Kittles had a season-high nine rebounds. ...New Jersey attempted season high 29 three points, making eight.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
